snippet: The Yankees were not interested in courting starter C. J. Wilson this off-season, but they could be more aggressive next winter, when the free-agent starters should be much more appealing.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column suggests that the New York Yankees may have passed on acquiring free-agent pitcher C J Wilson in order to pursue younger free-agent starters next winter.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees were not interested in courting starter C. J. Wilson this off-season, but they could be more aggressive next winter, when the free-agent starters should be much more appealing.

headline.seo: Yankees Saving Now to Make Free-Agent Splash Later
headline.main: Yankees Are Saving Now for a Potential Splash Next Winter
headline.print_headline: Yankees Are Saving Now for a Potential Splash Next Winter
